questions.question_text:
The following table displays the row-level data in a Tableau data source.

//IMG//


A Data Analyst creates this calculated field:

SUM(IF [Item] = 'A' THEN [Sales] END) / COUNT([Order ID])

What is the result of this aggregate calculation?

Which option must a Data Analyst enable to build the following table to add quarterly totals?

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Pane Totals calculate subtotals within each pane, such as quarterly subtotals for each row (Category) across monthly columns. In this view, each quarter is a pane, and “Full Quarter” reflects the total within that pane.

Selected Answer: B
Answer is correct. The field must be a Boolean data type (True/False or 1/0) to represent the on/off state of the object's visibility.

questions.question_text: Which attributes are required for the field that is used to hide or show an object with Dynamic Zone Visibility?

choices.C: String, Fixed Level of Detail (LOD), Dependent on the viz
choices.A: Single Value, Integer. Independent of the viz
choices.B: Boolean, Single Value, Independent of the viz
choices.D: Boolean, Fixed Level of Detail (LOD), Single Value

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Asking for Category: "Office Supplies" and "Furniture"

Selected Answer: D
"Office Supplies" and "Furnitures has a sub-category with negative profit. Therefore, there are 2 distinct categories.

questions.question_text:
A Data Analyst has the following worksheet, with Profit data for Category and Sub-Category.

//IMG//


The analyst executed the following calculated field at the Total level.

COUNTD( IF { INCLUDE [Sub-Category]: SUM([Profit]) < 0 } THEN [Category] END )

What is the result?

choices.C: Create a calculated field that uses a formula of' '$' + str (([Sales]/1000)).
choices.D: Change the data type of the Sales field to String.
choices.B: Create a calculated field that uses a formula of '$' + str (Round([Sales],2)) + 'K'.
choices.A: Change the default number format of the Sales field.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Change the default number format of the Sales field
A- change the sales field in the data pane suing the default properties for number format.

B will not work because it rounds to only 2 digits, but some of the values are 3 digits.
C will not work because it will not append the 'K'.
D will not work because converting to string would only convert the numeric data type into a string with the same value.

A is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct. we can achieve it through calculated field as well but it will add new measure/dimension
